intro: Scrophularia sulaimanica, commonly known as the Sulaiman Scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan and Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the genus. Scrophularia sulaimanica is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
